name: Peter Thiel
background: Peter Andreas Thiel (born October 11, 1967) is a German-American billionaire entrepreneur, venture capitalist, and political activist. A co-founder of PayPal, Palantir Technologies, and Founders Fund, he was the first outside investor in Facebook. Thiel authored Zero to One: Notes on Startups, or How to Build the Future (2014), which became a New York Times bestseller. He advocates definite optimism, technological innovation (0 to 1 progress), and building monopolies through proprietary technology. Thiel studied philosophy and law at Stanford, influenced by René Girard. Net worth ~$20B+ as of 2025. Sources: Wikipedia, Zero to One summaries.

principles.name: Definite Optimism
principles.description: Plan specifically for a better future you can build (definite optimism) vs. indefinite optimism (hoping without plans). Contrast with definite/indefinite pessimism.
principles.falsification: When definite optimism leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Monopolies over Competition
principles.description: Competition is for losers; build defensible monopolies via proprietary technology (10x better), network effects, economies of scale, or branding. Start small and dominate a niche.
principles.falsification: When monopolies over competition leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Progress from 0 to 1
principles.description: True innovation creates something new (vertical progress) rather than copying or improving existing things (horizontal, 1 to n progress). Focus on breakthroughs over globalization.
principles.falsification: When progress from 0 to 1 leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Proprietary Technology
principles.description: Build products 10x better than alternatives through secret insights or engineering. Avoid commoditized markets.
principles.falsification: When proprietary technology leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
